newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds continued their run higher on Thursday, with 10-year futures setting yet another record, as buyers remained ready to snap up paper despite the gains already achieved.
"Supports are being consolidated at ever higher levels and the future is breaking maximums," a dealer said. "Despite the accumulated gains there are still those ready to buy."

The market continued to be buoyed by views the 1997 budget - expected to be approved by the cabinet on Friday - would be austere and would persuade the Bank of Spain to reduce its 7.25 percent key money market rate soon.
"People continue to be positive toward Spain," a dealer said. "There is a risk of a correction, but people don't seem to be ready to sell at the moment."
